meanings.definition: What you see is what you get.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained that 'wysiwyg' means you get exactly what you see.
meanings.sent2: When shopping online, the product image should match the actual item received - that's 'wysiwyg'.
meanings.sent3: I told my friend my magic trick was 'wysiwyg' - what you see is what you get, no tricks!
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was like a 'wysiwyg' signpost in a world of hidden agendas.
meanings.sent5: The clear glass jar was a perfect example of 'wysiwyg' - you could see all the contents clearly.

meanings.definition: A software program or interface that allows users to see how a document will appear when printed or displayed on a screen.
meanings.sent1: The new 'wysiwyg' software helped me design my poster exactly as it would look when printed.
meanings.sent2: Graphic designers often use 'wysiwyg' tools to ensure their layouts are visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the 'wysiwyg' program was like a crystal ball for my documents.
meanings.sent4: The 'wysiwyg' interface transformed my chaotic ideas into a polished presentation.
meanings.sent5: With the 'wysiwyg' feature, I could preview my website before publishing it online.
